author: chunqingchen
body:
resolve #4355

Removed cmdlets from IntialSessionState.cs so they will not be available on unix platforms.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body:
Usually we exclude not ported cmdlets with `#if !UNIX` (or exclude whole file in csproj) and remove from [psd1](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/tree/master/src/Modules/Unix)

Also we need correct tests in [DefaultCommands.Tests.ps1](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/test/powershell/engine/Basic/DefaultCommands.Tests.ps1)

comments.author: chunqingchen
comments.body: @iSazonov in issue  #4355 you mentioned not implantation exception should be added instead of excluding the cmdlets. Is that not the case now?

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: @chunqingchen Sorry, my comment was not approved. I remember @daxian-dbw said that it is better exclude code in csproj - it is easy to track. @daxian-dbw Could you confirm?

comments.author: chunqingchen
comments.body: @adityapatwardhan your comments are resolved.

comments.author: vinodc
comments.body: @paulcallen Would you happen to know if `New-PSSessionOption` has been disabled? We updated to the latest version from 6.0.0 beta1 and this no longer works. It was previously working great and we have been using it with `New-PSSessionOption` since https://github.com/PowerShell/psl-omi-provider/issues/67 was merged in.

comments.author: dantraMSFT
comments.body:
@vinodc I'll dig into this.  For now, you can use [System.Management.Automation.Remoting.PSSessionOption]::new() and populate the returned object.

BTW: What's the use case you have for it on Linux.  Perhaps it was missed with the cmdlet was removed.

comments.author: vinodc
comments.body:
@dantraMSFT Thanks for the quick response. We are programmatically accessing Office 365 PowerShell cmdlets and in the process our code creates PSSessionOption objects. We can work around this temporarily, but wanted to make sure that the overall implementation itself is still supported for related commands used to connect to Office 365 PowerShell, starting with `New-PSSessionOption`.

On a broader note, this is related to piped commands failing (https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/issues/6206), where we were recommended to update PowerShell first to see if we could reproduce the failure on the latest version, which resulted in these new issues coming up.

comments.author: dreyTee
comments.body:
> @paulcallen Would you happen to know if `New-PSSessionOption` has been disabled? 

Have same issue when trying to  use WINRM from linux without proper server certificate:
Getting error:
`Use the PSSessionOption -SkipCACheck and -SkipCNCheck`
Trying to use thes options with `New-PSSessionOption` but can't:
`New-PSSessionOption : The term 'New-PSSessionOption' is not recognized as the name of a cmdlet, function, script file, or operable program.`
Please advise a workaround a least.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: @dreyTee Please open new issue for your question.

title: Disable cmdlets that are not supported under unix system
